subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Unicode proposal again.
msgSnippet: I ve been very busy lately, and I don t have time to look into this right now, but my first impression is that unifying Quikscript with Shavian makes the same
messageBody:
I've been very busy lately, and I don't have time to
look into this right now, but my first impression is
that unifying Quikscript with Shavian makes the
same mistake originally made in unifying Coptic
with Greek.

And would we need two different encodings for
some characters so as to have a regular character
and a combining character for Junior versus Senior
Quikscript?

--Ph. D.

----- Original Message -----
From: "Michael Everson" <everson@...>
To: <Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, May 28, 2007 1:57 PM
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Unicode proposal again.


Peter asked this on the Unicode forum, and I responded:

One question that needs to be addressed (and has since
I asked this a year or so ago) is whether it can be unified
with Shavian.

Peter responded to me privately:

"Looking at it there are only a few glyphs with the same
shape in Shavian and they have totally different meanings
so I don't think they can be unified."

This needs substantiation.

I love encoding. I'm a splitter, normally, not a lumper. But
if I'm not convinced about disunifying Quikscript from the
Shavian it derives from, the UTC and WG2 certainly
won't be.

This discussion begins, alas, just as I am about to go on
a fortnight's holiday. My e-mail access will be spotty from
tomorrow until 14 June. But tonight (as I'm all packed but
for my computer) I'll look into this.
